name: CC+ Cream Full Coverage Color Correcting Foundation with SPF 50+
about: What it is: The #1 SPF foundation in America* is a full-coverage foundation, hydrating & anti-aging serum, and SPF 50+ sunscreen in one—now in extended shades...Coverage: Full..Finish: Natural..Formulation: Cream..SPF: SPF over 30..Skin Type: Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily..Highlighted Ingredients:.-Hyaluronic Acid: Hydrates and plumps while minimizing the look of fine lines & wrinkles..-Niacinamide: Minimizes the look of discoloration & promotes even-toned, radiant skin..-Vitamin E: Helps soothe and nourish skin..Ingredient Callouts: Free of sulfates parabens and phthalates...What Else You Need to Know: The full coverage, natural finish of a CC cream foundation meets hydration to color correct and camouflage skin concerns like acne scars, wrinkles, redness, dark circles under eyes, large pores & uneven skin tone. Made with skin-loving ingredients, it moisturizes for visibly healthy & smooth skin..*Source: The NPD Group/US Prestige Beauty Total Measured Market, Makeup Product Sales, January - December 2021.
ingredients: Active Ingredients .Titanium Dioxide 9%.Zinc Oxide 6.3%..Cosmetic Ingredients .Water, Phenyl Trimethicone, Dimethicone, Butylene Glycol. Butylene Glycol Dicaprylate/Dicaprate, Orbignya Oleifera Seed Oil, Butyloctyl Salicylate, Cetyl Peg/Ppg-10/1 Dimethicone, Cyclopentasiloxane, Snail Secretion Filtrate, Aluminum Hydroxide, Magnesium Sulfate, Polyglyceryl-4 Isostearate, Stearic Acid, Cyclohexasiloxane, Dimethicone/Vinyl Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Hexyl Laurate, Calcium Stearate, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethyl Hexanediol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Limonene, Citrus Limon (Lemon) Peel Oil, Sorbitan Isostearate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Phenoxyethanol, Citrus Aurantium Bergamia (Bergamot) Fruit Oil, 1,2-Hexanediol, Adenosine, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Oil, Citrus Aurantifolia (Lime) Oil, Pinus Sylvestris Leaf Oil, Linalool, Eucalyptus Globulus Leaf Oil, Glycerin, Citral, Niacinamide, Hyaluronic Acid, Colloidal Oatmeal, Hydrolyzed Collagen, Steareth-20, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Olea Europaea (Olive) Leaf Extract, Chlorhexidine Digluconate, N-Hydroxysuccinimide, Silk Extract, Hydrolyzed Silk, Sodium Citrate, Potassium Sorbate, Palmitoyl Tripeptide-1, Chrysin, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-7, Citric Acid, Biotin..May Contain Titanium Dioxide, Iron Oxides
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.- Apply 1-2 pumps of CC+ Cream SPF 50+ to clean skin. .- For best results, use a foundation makeup brush IT Cosmetics Heavenly Luxe Complexion Perfection Brush #7 (sold separately) to buff and blend a smooth, even layer of foundation onto your face, neck and décolleté. .- To set, use Bye Bye Pores Translucent Pressed Setting Powder (sold separately) and finish it off with It's Your Skin But Better Setting Spray for a flawless finish that lasts. .Tip: Focus on parts of your face that may need the most coverage first, such as under your eyes, around your nose and mouth, chin and center of forehead—all of which typically require color correction for uneven skin tone.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Can’t believe I waited so long to try this. I understand the hype now and I don’t think I’ll ever have a different base for daily use again. This stuff has awesome coverage and doesn’t show my dry flaky skin nearly as much as other foundations. And it’s got such a nice natural finish. It blends out nicely and evenly and I love that it has SPF. I have other foundations for when I don’t need the SPF but really this stuff is my HG for daily wear, plus the packaging is good for travel. A well deserved five stars!

reviews.review_text: I was surprised how much I loved this product! Easy to apply, great coverage and dewey finish. (usually prefer matte finishes due to oily skin) not too oily, lasts long and does not break me out! Mineral SPF was exactly what I was looking for.

For reference, I used it with the “Your Skin But Better” Oil-Free Primer, the “Your Most Beautiful You” pressed powder bronzer, highlighter, and blush palette, and the “Bye-Bye Pores Pressed Setting Powder.” I applied the primer with my fingers, but everything else with a sponge.  The packaging is excellent.

reviews.review_text: I have been using this for years and love the coverage and moisture it gives my aging, dry skin.  It leaves my skin even toned with a youthful glow. Let it dry naturally without any setting powder to avoid cakeiness. Just use a tissue to lightly dab any under eye creasing to take away excess for a natural look.  It looks great all day and can withstand a hot flash! (dab away sweat) My face is fair (sunblock) but have some variation of Florida tan throughout the year, so I use light medium shade in the winter and medium in the summer.

reviews.review_text: I was in the store, and just try it on, and I love it, bought one. That week I went for a vacation and brought it with me, it was very humid. It never disappointed me. I like the coverage, it stayed even when I was sweaty. I love the effect on my face, it covers impurities.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted to really like this but unfortunately, I did not think it was worth the price. I have redness around my nose and mouth, and while it color corrected immediately after application it did not last for more than an hour - and that's in addition to using a green color corrector underneath it. I also found it didn't blend very well - whether using a beauty blender, puff, or brush. It was worth the try but I won't be getting it again. I think there are comparable cc creams for a fraction of the cost.

This product is something I use every single day, and it works so well on my skin. It is so flawless and smoothing, and I can really build the coverage up or keep it light depending on what I need it for. I’ve worn this to fancy events and NYFW, as well as everyday to work. Seriously love this product and rave about it all the time. It also works great under any cream or powder products so it’s not a hassle to deal with!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This product is not worth the money. Everyone has different skin, but for me, it separated a lot and would not stay on my nose. It also oxidizes and made me feel super greasy.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_text: I’ve been using this for a month or two now, it oxidizes and settles into any fine lines you may have. I think it makes you look a lot older, exaggerates fine lines and texture of your skin. Wish I would’ve returned when I first got it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Wanted to love this because it had spf but it didn’t work for my oily skin and especially not in the heat, I set it with setting spray and powder and it still came off when sweaty… I’m returning because for that price it’s a no for me

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Does not clog pores, provides a natural complexion, lasts long, and offers good sun protection. This is my favorite CC cream, with it I have forgotten about the existence of foundations.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I've been using this product for a few years and love the creamy texture and the way it evens out my skin tone. The SPF 50 is really important to me. I've tried other brands and tend to have reactions from preservatives but not with this product.

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Fair Light - ivory pink shade with cool undertones
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am so sad. This was my holy grail for many years. I am fair skin but always loved the Light shade to give me good coverage and a bit of color. This really stopped working for me about 2 years ago. The composition may be a bit different but the big issue is that the LIGHT shade is orange now. I been in denial for a while, wasting money thinking I will find the right shade again. I tried all the other fair shades and they all come out greyish. Now I understand the company was aquired, and the formulation changed. I moved on to the DoubleWear foundation.

reviews.review_title: Must have if you have rosacea

reviews.review_title: Don’t waste your time, it feels awful.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The product looks good but it doesn’t feel good on the face, it feels heavy and you can feel the oils and the slipping after a few hours. I honestly regret buying this but not more than I regret buying the matte one.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The BEST full coverage foundation out there! I get daily compliments how flawless my skin looks. Have recommended to many! Thank you IT!

reviews.review_title: No for oily/combo skin, but a maybe for dry skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product as a freebie sample from Sephora. I used the 'tan' color which looked a bit flat on my complexion but I was able to fix it using my regular contour and concealer. The CC cream is thick but not heavy. It was very lightweight and didn't feel like I had on makeup. This product is not for people with oily or combination skin, especially not on a hot 93 degree day. I ended up applying 2 different settings - one spray (One Size) and one powder (my tried and true l'oreal infallible setting powder), which finally did the trick and I was able to wear it. If you have dry skin, this may work for you.  One final thing. The sample container was small (obvi) but had enough product for my entire face. But the fine print on the packaging said quantity not sufficient for sunscreen protection which means you'll still need sunscreen before you apply.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Loved for years until in HI and found the SPF is not rated Coral Reef Safe!!!!  Was my go to— now going without until I find replacement!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I don't usually write reviews, but after seeing so many negative ones about this IT CC cream, I had to comment. I have very oily skin, and a lot of foundations like to separate on my skin.  With this IT CC cream, my makeup doesn't separate. I always use a makeup primer, and I have found that putting a tiny bit of this foundation onto the back of my hand, and then a couple squirts of my Sephora setting spray, really helps to spread the foundation in a thin layer on my face. I use a tapping motion in the spots I want heavier coverage. AND I use the amazing BK Beauty foundation brush, which really makes a difference in application!  I highly recommend using a setting spray mixed in with this foundation when you apply...try it and see if it helps. This pic is on my 50th birthday a couple of weeks ago, and I was wearing this CC cream (not the best quality pic because I zoomed in on myself haha).

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Perfectly blends with the skin. Definitely would buy again

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is the first product I’ve ever had to return to Sephora. I had tested the colour in person and it fit me good. When it arrived in the mail I had applied to my face. It was so thick and cakey, and seperated in my face. It also oxidized and make me look so yellow. Don’t recommend.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love the coverage but even the lightest shade isn’t quite light enough once it oxidizes. Almost a bit orangey. That said I still wear it in summer for the spf and coverage plus it smells awesome!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Beautiful coverage, easily blended out, natural looking, love how light it feels on the skin. It is not a long wear product tho.

reviews.review_title: I fell for the hype, and was so disappointed
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really expected to love this product, and was so excited to try it.  The colour was great, the coverage was pretty good, but the separation was AWFUL! Mid way through the day, the CC cream was so blotchy, and visibly separating on my skin. I've tried with and without primer, setting powder, and setting spray. It may just be a no-go for my skin, but it is a hard no-go for me.

reviews.review_title: Your face will shine and look greasy
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Not good, feels very heavy on my face, and I just wanted to wash it off my face, plus it gives you greasy skin, and the shade, even the lightest, is very dark, (why it is called “light” Idk, misleading. name)

reviews.review_title: My #1 holy grail product for years
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I've been using IT Cosmetics for close to 5 years now, and I continue to LOVE this product. I always apply it with just my fingers and mix a little bit of a gel-texture moisturizer with the product to make it spread a little easier and make it slightly less thick. A little goes a very long way! I have extremely sensitive skin and this is truly the only CC Cream/Foundation type of product that I can use on my face without having a reaction. The SPF is also amazing and I literally use it as my face sunscreen (and never get burned on my face when I'm wearing it - ever)! I've played around with shades over the years, and Fair Light is my closest match. I often mix it with a Light Medium in the summer time.

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Fair Light - ivory pink shade with cool undertones
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I really appreciate having a tinted sunscreen as my makeup choice.  This product provides full coverage and is really a bit too thick for my 85 year old skin.  I like it, but truly think the cc Nude Glow is a better choice for elderly skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

Such a waste of money, I would return it if I hadn't used so much of it, trying to give it a fair chance.

reviews.review_title: A must have if you’re low maintenance
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This was amazing. I’m super low maintenance, haven’t worn make up in years b/c I don’t like the feel & honestly I would wear this everyday. It’s no different than putting moisturizer on and you can’t even tell I’m wearing it.

reviews.review_title: Works on my combo skin in the desert
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is the only thing that has worked for my skin in a desert climate. I use a damp sponge to apply. I use a translucent powder to set it after applying. Since I’m very active my skin gets a bit oily after a few hours but I use blotting sheets. My makeup doesn’t separate after a long day.   My skin is prone to makeup looking cakey or cracked due to combo skin being super dry and oily in the t zone.   It took me a couple tries to get the color right. The light is too dark for me so I went to fair light and it’s a great match.   Desert weather is a different kind of dry I didn’t experience until now. Grateful to have found this since my old makeup routine did not work for this climate.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It looked beautiful but then within a couple of hours it became an oily mess. I Tried out inky sample and it broke out like crazy all over my face. Awful. Wasn’t sure 100% it was this item but now I am. Gonna take long to heal.

reviews.review_title: Amazing but not for sensitive skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is honestly the most natural, beautiful foundation I’ve ever used. It looks like your skin but better, except it’s full coverage. So comfortable. Not drying, not greasy just looks like skin. HOWEVER.. I have very sensitive, acne prone skin and after a week of wear I broke out pretty badly in irritation like breakouts. I’m assuming from all of the citrus oils. I wish they would make a sensitive skin version of the original.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_text: I've been using this product for over 2 weeks now and I really like it.  At first, I tried applying with my fingers but I wasn't overly impressed with the results.  Started using a brush and the product blends so much better.  I wouldn't call it full coverage but it does conceal my hyperpigmentation spots without looking cakey.  I like that it has SPF for summer because hormones are creating enough havoc with my complexion that I don't want to deal with sun damage too.  Overall, I like this product and I would buy it again.

reviews.review_title: Full coverage but not for combo skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The coverage is beautiful with this CC cream, it blurs pores and stays put ALL DAY. Even spending the day at the beach and in the water this stuff did not budge. I have combination skin, so on my oilier areas it worked great, however I tend to have some dryness around my chin and jawline and this, unfortunately, showed up every little dry patch and made it worse! By the end of the day, my skin would be significantly dryer and irritated in these areas. This would be perfect for oily skin, but if you're prone to some dry spots, this may not be for you.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love this foundation. It covers my rosacea and leaves a natural finish. It’s so beautiful. It’s not too thick and does not clog my pores. And it’s spf 50. I will say it creases at my smile lines which does not matter to me my skin is not perfect but this foundation make it look very close to perfect!

reviews.review_title: beautiful w/ fingers on moisturized skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is not only a beautiful foundation, but also an effective undereye concealer. I'm not one to use base products all over the face, I like to just target my undereyes, blemishes, and redness areas.   I wasn't a fan when I used this all over the face like I am with most foundations. However, I tried it again and have found it to look amazing using these rules that I've found works for me: 1) make sure my skin is moisturized. maybe this is obvious to some people, but it really makes a difference. 2) i use a little at a time, layering. and i mean a LITTLE at a time. i find it looks way less cakey this way, and this product has great coverage so you can just build it up using light layers. 3) i use my fingers. it's easy, i feel like the warmth of my fingers blends it in better.  overall, this is a really beautiful product. the first time i really got it right using the above steps, i couldn't stop looking at my skin. it's a great all-over product that i can use on blemishes, redness, and the undereye area.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin

I love how it is so buildable, if I want a lighter skin like finish I use like half a pump but when i want a full beat one pump goes a long way!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Not for sensitive skin types! I'd recently ran out of my everyday CC cream by 'Juice Beauty' - the ONLY CC cream I've ever repurchased, and had a small tube of this - a product I've heard lots about, and decided now's as good as any time to give it a try.  The pros: it has a higher SPF...50 as opposed to JB's 30, it's not anywhere near as 'dewy', and likewise has an ingredients list that reads like an encyclopedia of botanicals!  The cons: it's costlier per ml. And more importantly something in that mix, I'm guessing the citrus oils; gave me a rash on my nose and forehead after less than a week of applying every morning, and I ended up giving this away. It could also have been the silicones or possibly the Eucalyptus oil...who knows?  Disappointed to say the least, as the coverage was PERFECT for me - medium, not too dewy and didn't emphasize any of my fine lines or general rough texture (on those days I've been too lazy to exfoliate) which I was fearing it might do from reading some of the other reviews. For a short while I felt like I'd found an even better version of my beloved JB CC cream, and was happy to overlook the price difference, but unfortunately it wasn't meant to be. If you're sensitive to essential oils or silicones, then definitely try before you buy!   ~ My Sephora Top 7 must-have list ~  (My top 7 must-have beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Sephora)  1. Hair Loss Treatment: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Hair Oil  2. Shampoo: 'Sephora Collection' - Deep Cleaning Shampoo 3. Face Mask: ‘Peter Thomas Roth’ – Pumpkin Enzyme Mask  4. Pigmentation + Anti-Aging Serum: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Facial Treatment Serum 5. Face Scrub: ‘Sisley' - Botanical Gentle Buffing Cream 6. Lip Balm: ‘Nuxe’ – Reve De Miel Lip Balm 7. Lip Liner: ‘Sephora Collection' - Rouge Gel Lip Liner

I love that it does not dry out my skin, and rarely creases. My skin feels moisturized and protected with this CC+ cream, as it has SPF 50+ as well, which I love!! I highly recommend.

reviews.review_text: Using this product for more than 6 years and I can’t replace it with anything else.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am 55 and have used this product in summer for years but I find that as my skin gets more mature (and I have very dry skin), I have to moisturize really well under this to make it look good.  It is a full-coverage foundation despite the name, so many will not need this level of coverage however I have bad skin (rosacea acne and redness).  This foundation is GREAT under all lighting conditions including office lighting that can make me look like a zombie.  Good shade range and I got samples in store to pick the correct one.  I personally am extremely pale but freckled so I find that I need a *slightly* darker and more yellow shade than my non-freckled areas.  Wears like iron and requires few touch ups IMO.  I do use a very slight dusting of powder over it.

I still wanted to love it, so I made sure I put extra setting powder on and setting spray the next day. It wore slightly better, but was very spotty and wore off in a lot of places. Very disappointing will be returning.

reviews.review_title: it's a no from me dawg

I have combo skin, blemishes and texture but also dry skin and compromised skin barrier (which im working to improve). this looked SOOO bad. it settles into lines I didn't even know existed, highlighted every individual little peach fuzz on my face, was EXTREMELY drying and difficult to blend. plus the pump is awful, I sat there pumping for like 2 minutes to get little splatters out. save your money sis 'cause this ain't it. or at least try in store first. you may find this works for you if you have extremely oily skin or perfect glass skin to begin with. reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is - hands down - the best full coverage foundation for mature and dry skin types on the market. The fact that it has the added bonuses of skincare and physical sunscreen built in is incredible. Look, if you're 20, this isn't for you (yet). I tried this when I was younger and it felt thick and masky. But when I reached my mid 30s, this became my go to. I apply with a dampened beauty blender and it is budge-proof, fast, FULL coverage that really covers and smooths the look of your skin. I keep trying new things that come out to see if other products people are raving about are better and nothing holds a candle to this. Nothing. It Cosmetics better not ever stop making this because I don't know what I would do. Can't recommend highly enough, and I love that they offer smaller sizes for you to try and that they have broadened their shade range. The best makeup product I have ever purchased - and I have purchased A LOT. This would be my desert island must have. Won't be without it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using this product for probably close to a decade. When it was time to repurchase, I noticed the price increased significantly. I bought a mini size in shade light that was, I'm not kidding, pure orange. I had to go in the store to test and discovered my perfect shade is fair ivory. This makes no sense since I am light/medium usually with olive undertones. I decided to keep the mini in light to mix with my full size fair ivory for my summer shade.   I'm writing this review because I think the shade matching is incredibly difficult if you can't make it into the store to swatch. With all that being said, I do still love the formula of this product. It's pretty full coverage (I mean like, I use half a pump to cover my entire face, and blend it out with a beauty blender). It's perfect for mornings when I just want to throw something on like it's a moisturizer. I swear, I don't even need to wear priming cream underneath for it to look good. Without primer, it can cling to some dry patches on my face but it's really not too bad for me. With primer, my skin looks glowing all day. It almost looks better as the day goes on. I will also add that it oxidizes so in my opinion, it would be wise to shade down if possible.   Super easy to use, just use with a light hand. Giving four stars because it's VERY expensive from what it once was and the shades run incredibly dark.

reviews.review_text: I’ve been using this for years. It’s the only thing I will constantly repurchase. Doesn’t get enough hype. It covers EVERYTHING. doesn’t make me breakout or feel gross if wearing all day

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation is so natural looking with amazing coverage. I've been wearing it for five years now and no other foundation I have tried lives up to the quality, finish, and feel of this. It feels great on the skin; it's moisturizing without being oily. Also I swear it improves my skin (acne, redness) which is crazy because I wouldn't expect wearing makeup to help my skin! It lasts pretty well to the end of the day too -- even though it fades a bit as it gets absorbed into the skin throughout the day, it somehow keeps my skin looking even and vibrant until I take it off. Plus it has SPF 50?! Regarding some negative reviews I've seen, I would say the trick is to find the right shade for you as my right shade looks so natural on my skin it barely looks like I'm wearing foundation, and because of that I often wear it alone, with not even mascara! Worth every last penny.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I used this for 7 years and in that time there were 2 noticeable changes to the formula. When I first started using this the palest shade was ~ actually ~ pale, the coverage was medium and it looked like skin! Then the shade range took a turn for the worse with all of them becoming orange-y and not enough options for complexions on either end of the spectrum. However, I would always find my way back to it because I loved the finish and it was one of the few products that agreed with my extremely sensitive, dry, acne prone skin. I was willing to make the shade work with a lighter concealer and despite finding the product would kind of go off.. before I would ever finish a tube (3-4 months) , unlike the first couple years of using this. I took a break from using this to try another foundation and in that time frame I also developed perioral dermatitis. When I came back to try this (after releasing a shade pale enough!) after minimizing my makeup routine and healing the dermatitis it triggered another outbreak/no longer works for my skin anymore! It is too bad because it worked for a long time and the claims are for extremely sensitive skin conditions like PD,etc (with some even saying this is one of the only foundations that work for it)! Happy to see the shade  The pros: goes over flakiness well, skin-like finish, can be good for sensitive skin ?, does not make my skin feel tight, moisturizing and plumping The cons: shade range isn’t great- even for the new pale colours they are very yellow, transfers if you rub or touch your face/clothing, starts to break down (but doesn’t look too bad), the price honestly.. has gone up over $20 since I first started buying it :(

I purchased another shade in another brand and cocktail them together to get better results. There's nothing wrong with this product, it's my skin tone that the issue.

reviews.review_text: I have pretty dry skin so when I use any CC cream or foundation I have trouble with dry patches causing the makeup to flake off. But these CC cream has been my go to for years, and I do not have the same problem as mentioned before. I have tried many other products and always find myself going back to IT.

Worst experience ever with a foundation! It ruined my new bag ...even my french manicure got stained. I tryied to clean the bag with every product available ( the bag is an Mz Wallace, nylon fabric very easy to wipe and clean, they are even washable),  neither the dry cleaner could take the stain away! I wonder what kind of chemicals this brand uses that can stain fabrics and nail polish like that. I never stain anything, not even white shirts, and I use makeup everyday. Dont know how this happened, maybe the product never dries up and with a minimal touch or using your phone and then putting it in your bag can cause this mess. I ended putting a new $300 bag in the trash

reviews.review_title: Nice full coverage foundation, but no flash photos

reviews.review_text: Blends well with both fingers and beauty blender, and useable as a foundation or concealer. Definitely a VERY full coverage foundation and not a BB/CC cream vibe - a little goes a long way. SPF protects very well and lasts long! Looks fresh all day with good skincare and priming. Works great on my combination skin, too. Photographs extremely well, except for at night / with flash where it makes me look white as a ghost due to the SPF (that's my only complaint). Great daytime product, though!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am a full coverage kind of girl but I also want my makeup to look like Skin and I want a Really good SPF because I have dark spots from the sun on my pale skin!  is this too much to ask? 😆  that said, I LOVE this cc cream. its pricey. That is the only caveat. aside from that, one pump covers my imperfect skin beautifully... sometimes I need 2 but never more than that. it covers beautifully while still looking like dewy skin. granted, it can come off easily when you blow your nose or if you get oily through the day, but setting spray usually fixes this issue. especially if you spray your beauty blender before bouncing it on your face. I do suggest this method of application to avoid cakeyness, but its up to you.

reviews.review_title: IT Cosmetics CC+ Cream Foundation: A Coverage Cr
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It is with immense disappointment that I share my experience with IT Cosmetics' CC+ Cream Full Coverage Color Correcting Foundation with SPF 50+. My encounter with this product at Sephora has left me questioning the brand's claims and its ability to deliver on its promises.  Excited by the prospect of a full-coverage foundation with added skincare benefits, I was eager to try the CC+ Cream. However, my excitement quickly turned to frustration upon application.  Despite the full coverage claim, the foundation's coverage was anything but. The formula proved to be streaky and difficult to blend, leaving me with uneven patches and the need for extensive layering to achieve even minimal coverage. Instead of achieving a flawless complexion, I ended up with a cakey and unnatural finish that was far from the radiant glow I had hoped for.  Furthermore, the foundation's color selection left much to be desired. The shade range seemed limited and failed to cater to a diverse range of skin tones. This oversight is disappointing given the industry's growing emphasis on inclusivity and the varied needs of customers.  Equally concerning was the foundation's staying power. Despite claims of long-lasting wear, the CC+ Cream seemed to break down and fade within a few hours of application, leaving me with an uneven complexion and requiring frequent touch-ups. This lack of longevity is particularly disappointing considering the high expectations set by the brand.  To make matters worse, the customer service experience with Sephora has not been satisfactory. After reaching out to express my dissatisfaction with the product, I received a response that lacked any meaningful resolution. It is disheartening to invest in a product that falls short of expectations and then receive a dismissive response from the retailer.

J'ai utilisé ce produit en Grèce pendant trois semaines. Un trois-en 1: au lieu d'appliquer un soin, une crème hydratante et une protection solaire, ce produit faisait les 3. Sauve du temps en vacances et la protection solaire était très efficace.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I remember absolutely loving the formula of this product when I first tried it a few summers ago. The coverage was out of this world and the built-in SPF didn’t break me out, which is very rare for me. I was heartbroken when I had to let it go because the lightest shade at the time, Fair, was just way too dark for my complexion. When I saw that the shade range had expanded, I ran to the store to swatch some contenders and found a perfect match in Fair Porcelain! Applied it the next day hoping that the formula hadn’t changed and fortunately, all was as well as I remember. My undereyes did admittedly look a little ashy over time, but perhaps this foundation simply doesn’t pair well with my current undereye CC (it wouldn't be the first). I’ll find an alternative concealer if I must - I’m committed to keeping this product in my collection! Full coverage without the weight of a full-coverage foundation, honestly the best, especially through summer. I wear the Hourglass Veil Mineral Primer (my holy grail) underneath it like I would with any foundation/CC/etc. and it holds up beautifully. Truly don’t think I’ve ever had a better foundation shade match for my complexion, and I’ve tried a boatload of them. I do think there could be a further shade range expansion across the board for this product but think this is a good start. Thank you, ITC 🙌🏻 P.S. If you find this version of the CC too drying, maybe give the Nude Glow version a try.
